sen.j: 山鹿 秀遠（やまが ひでとお、生没年未詳）は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Hideto YAMAGAthe (the date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
Hideto YAMAGA (the date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: YAMAGAthe→YAMAGA"lived"を追加平安時代後期ではなく末期なので修正しました。
sen.e: Hideto YAMAGA (the date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 筑前国遠賀郡山鹿の豪族。
sen.e: He was from Gozoku (local ruling family) in Yamaga, Onga County, Chikuzen Province.
His family was a Gozoku (local ruling family) in Yamaga, Onga County, Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 豪族出身ではなく、豪族であるのでfromを削除しました。
sen.e: His family was a Gozoku (local ruling family) in Yamaga, Onga County, Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was commonly known as Hyotoji.
His common name was Hyotoji.
sen.cmt: 微妙に原文とのニュアンスが異なると考え、単語調査に基づいて書き換えました。
sen.e: His common name was Hyotoji.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『菊池系図』によると、大宰権帥藤原隆家の子政則が父と共に大宰府に下向し、鎮西の兵頭の宣旨を受けて兵藤と号した。
sen.e: According to "Kikuchi family tree", Masanori FUJIWARA, a son of FUJIWARA no Takaie who had been the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) left the capital to Dazaifu with his father, and designated himself as Hyoto under the imperial decree of Chinzei no Hyoto.

According to "Kikuchi Keizu" (the genealogy of the Kikuchi family), Masanori FUJIWARA, the son of FUJIWARA no Takaie who was the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), left the capital to Dazaifu with his father Takaie, and adopted another name Hyoto after being appointed to Chinzei no Hyoto under the imperial decree.
sen.cmt: 「鎮西の兵頭の宣旨を受けて」は「鎮西の兵頭（天皇の命令）に任命された」という意味で訳しました。菊池系図の記載、号するを変更しました。"son"の冠詞をtheに換えました。
sen.e: According to "Kikuchi Keizu" (the genealogy of the Kikuchi family), Masanori FUJIWARA, the son of FUJIWARA no Takaie who was the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), left the capital to Dazaifu with his father Takaie, and adopted another name Hyoto after being appointed to Chinzei no Hyoto under the imperial decree.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その子則隆は肥後国菊池に下って領主となり、菊池を称した。
sen.e: Masanori's son, Noritaka, went to Kikuchi County, Higo Province to become the feudal lord and called himself Kikuchi.
Masanori's son, Noritaka, went to Kikuchi County, Higo Province to become the feudal lord and called himself Kikuchi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Masanori's son, Noritaka, went to Kikuchi County, Higo Province to become the feudal lord and called himself Kikuchi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 秀遠はその子孫・経遠の子とするが、『尊卑分脈』で隆家の子に政則の名は見られない。
sen.e: Hideto was supposed to be a child of Tsuneto, Noritaka's descendent, although, the name of Masanori could not be seen in "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy) as a child of Takaie.

Hideto is supposed to have been a child of Noritaka's descendent Tsuneto, but according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the 14th century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), the children of Takaie does not include Masanori.
sen.cmt: 時制を替えました。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Hideto is supposed to have been a child of Noritaka's descendent Tsuneto, but according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the 14th century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), the children of Takaie does not include Masanori.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『平家物語』「大宰府落」で、都を追われた平氏一門が九州へ逃れて来ると、平家から源氏方に転じた緒方惟栄に追い払らわれた。
sen.e: Dazaifu-ochi' in "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike) tells that when the Taira clan exiled from Kyoto and escaped to Kyushu, they were expelled by Koreyoshi OGATA, who had converted from Heike (the Taira family) into Minamoto family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a description in the chapter of 'Dazaifu-ochi' of "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike) as follows: when the Taira clan took refuge in Kyushu after being exiled from Kyoto, they were expelled by Koreyoshi OGATA who had left the Taira clan and switched to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。"exile"は他動詞です。
sen.e: There is a description in the chapter of 'Dazaifu-ochi' of "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike) as follows: when the Taira clan took refuge in Kyushu after being exiled from Kyoto, they were expelled by Koreyoshi OGATA who had left the Taira clan and switched to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平家の家人であった秀遠と原田種直が軍勢を率いて迎えに参じた。
sen.e: Hideto and Tanenao HARADA, who were retainers of the Taira clan, led the army to welcome them but Hideto and Tanenao had a trouble and Tanenao returned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hideto and Tanenao HARADA, both of whom were retainers of the Taira family, came to meet them with their troops.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処clan→family
sen.e: Hideto and Tanenao HARADA, both of whom were retainers of the Taira family, came to meet them with their troops.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし両者の不和のため、種直は引き返している。
sen.e: However, Tanenao turned back to his home, because Hideto and Tanenao were in discord with each other.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処"had a trouble"では二人が困難に直面したことになり、原文と異なるため書き換えました。
sen.e: However, Tanenao turned back to his home, because Hideto and Tanenao were in discord with each other.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 秀遠に伴われた平氏一門は一時秀遠の山鹿の城に立て籠もったが、敵が攻めてくるとの知らせで再び海上へ逃れた。
sen.e: The Taira clan, accompanied by Hideto, confined themselves in the Hideto's Yamaga castle for a time, but freed again by sea.
The Taira clan accompanied by Hideto confined themselves to the Hideto's castle in Yamaga County for a time, but fled again on the sea after being informed that their enemy was approaching.
sen.cmt: 「敵が攻めてくるとの知らせで」が訳漏れです。山鹿の城の訳、海上へ逃れるの訳が原文と異なりますので修正しました。
sen.e: The Taira clan accompanied by Hideto confined themselves to the Hideto's castle in Yamaga County for a time, but fled again on the sea after being informed that their enemy was approaching.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『平家物語』では秀遠は九州第一の精兵とされ、壇ノ浦の戦いで平家方の大将軍として軍船を率いて奮戦した。
sen.e: In the "Heike Monogatari" Hideto was rated as the strongest warrior in Kyushu and he fought desperately at the Battle of Dan no ura as the Daishogun (command in chief) of the Taira side by leading warships.

"Heike Monogatari" describes Hideto as the strongest warrior in Kyushu, which includes a story that Hideto fought bravely in the naval battle of Dan no ura as the Daishogun (command in chief) of the Taira clan by leading warships.
sen.cmt: 原文と多少ニュアンスが異なる箇所を書き換えました。
sen.e: "Heike Monogatari" describes Hideto as the strongest warrior in Kyushu, which includes a story that Hideto fought bravely in the naval battle of Dan no ura as the Daishogun (command in chief) of the Taira clan by leading warships.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦後、所領は没官となった（『吾妻鏡』文治元年12月6日条）。
sen.e: After the war, his territory was confiscated (according to the "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East] in the article of December 6, 1185).
After the war, his territory was confiscated (according to the article of December 6, 1185 in "Azuma Kagami" [a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu]).
sen.cmt: 「吾妻鏡」の説明が不適と考え、用語集を参考に訂正しました。
sen.e: After the war, his territory was confiscated (according to the article of December 6, 1185 in "Azuma Kagami" [a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu]).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
